column5: My crew will be crossing the border Saturday night from International Falls into Fort Frances. I was wondering if there are any Canadian holidays that are being observed this coming weekend. We crossed around the same time last year, and for some reason the grocery stores were all closed in Dryden. Apparently there was some holiday that we were not aware of. We weren't sure if it was a Canadian holiday, or something specific to Ontario.

I suspect you encountered this: http://www.statutoryholidays.com/civic-holiday.phpIt will be August 1 this year.I have always admired a province which has a holiday that has absolutely nothing to do with remembering or honoring anything but is just an excuse to have a day off.

So....I am guessing many stores take the opportunity to take that entire weekend off to take full advantage of this civic holiday. I like that concept. If that's the case, I guess we can count on Wal-Mart to be open. I don't think they know the meaning of the word holiday.
In our area nongovernment places tend to have shortened Monday hours but regular Saturday and Sunday hours. LCBO I think is closed on Monday and so are government places.
Another great thing about Canada (in addition to nice people, great fishing and money with animals instead of dead old men on it!)
